articles.title: JavaScript's ??= Operator: Default Values Made Simple
articles.description: The ??= nullish coalescing assignment operator snuck into JavaScript a few years ago via ECMAScript 2021 and has been broadly supported almost everywhere for ages. Trevor shows off how it can tighten up your assignments here.
articles.author: Trevor I. Lasn

articles.title: üá∫üá∏¬†JSConf is Back; Here's the Details
articles.description: Two months ago, the OpenJS Foundation announced that the popular JSConf brand was joining the foundation and a new North American JSConf event would happen in due course. Now you can mark your calendars for October 14-16, 2025 for an event taking place in the Chesapeake Bay area of Maryland, USA.
articles.author: OpenJS Foundation

articles.title: Announcing Rspack 1.1
articles.description: Rspack is a fast, Rust-powered alternative to Webpack but with the same API. v1.1 boasts being 10% faster than v1.0 and has an improved, though still experimental, incremental build feature. If super fast build times are your bag, this needs to be on your radar.
articles.author: The Rspack Team

articles.title: Wasmer Adds Node.js and Bun Support
articles.description: Wasmer is a Rust-powered WebAssembly runtime and Wasmer 5.0 adds V8 and JavaScriptCore backend support, meaning you can try all sorts of things like, say, running Clang, Python, or even compiled JavaScript apps inside your own JavaScript app..
articles.author: Syrus Akbary

articles.title: Why Would Anyone Need Generator Functions?
articles.description: A golden oldie that I enjoyed revisiting because it covers an oft misunderstood and not particularly commonly encountered JavaScript feature.
articles.author: James Sinclair

articles.title: The Most Effective Ways to Improve Core Web Vitals
articles.description: Everyone wants their site to be as performant as possible, especially when Google factors performance into its rankings, but how? Google shares a variety of practical techniques to improve your INP, LCP, and CLS metrics here.
articles.author: Google

articles.title: Why Code Security Matters - Even in Hardened Environments
articles.description: A well diagrammed dive into a technique that allows malicious parties to turn a file write vulnerability in a Node.js app into a remote code execution exploit even when the file system is read-only.
articles.author: Stefan Schiller (Sonar)

articles.title: Generating Random Mazes with JavaScript
articles.description: A fun, well-presented walkthrough of a basic maze generation process.
articles.author: Paul Hebert

articles.title: npmpackage.info: Detailed Package Info on a Single Page
articles.description: Give this online tool the name of an npm package and you get a quick ‚Äòdashboard‚Äô style view of the project‚Äôs main statistics, covering areas like quality scores, commits, open issues, releases, bundle size, and more.
articles.author: Shrinath Nayak

articles.title: Docusaurus 3.6: The Docs-Oriented Static Site Generator
articles.description: Meta‚Äôs Docusaurus is a popular way to build docs sites (like these). v3.6 is focused on performance, now using tools like Rspack and SWC to make builds super fast.
articles.author: Meta

articles.title: Immutable.js 5.0: Immutable Collections for JavaScript
articles.description: Provides numerous persistent immutable data structures including a list, stack, map, ordered map, set, ordered set, and records.
articles.author: Lee Byron and Contributors

articles.title: Sonner 1.7: The Toast Notification React Component
articles.description: There‚Äôs a live demo to try on the homepage, or see the GitHub repo. v1.7 focuses on animation improvements, browser support, and React 19.
articles.author: Emil Kowalski

articles.title: Quaternion.js: A JavaScript Quaternion library
articles.description: Last week we featured the author‚Äôs Fraction.js library, now we go a step deeper with a way to work with 3D rotations using quarternions.
articles.author: Robert Eisele

articles.description: üèÜ The OpenJS Foundation has honored six JavaScript developers with awards in categories including Unsung Hero and Pathfinder for Education.
The working group behind the JSR package registry has met to outline plans for an open governance model and a roadmap to enhance JS package management.
‚ö†Ô∏è Phylum takes a look at yet another (ongoing) typosquatting campaign to try and trick JavaScript developers into installing malicious packages.
There's fewer than two weeks left to take the State of React 2024 survey.
Storybook offers a sneak peek at their Storybook Test tool for fast UI testing.
VitePress 1.5 ‚Äì Evan You's Vite and Vue-powered static site generator.
create-vue 3.12 ‚Äì The recommended way to start a Vite-powered Vue project. Now with an experimental Oxlint integration.
ESLint v9.14.0 ‚Äì Now supporting import attributes and regexp modifiers.
Mermaid 11.4 ‚Äì The popular diagram / charting tool adds Kanban diagrams.
React Navigation 7, Electron 33.1, TinyMCE 7.5.0, Bun v1.1.34

articles.title: A Friendly Introduction to Container Queries
articles.description: It‚Äôs been a couple of years now since the ‚Äúbiggest missing piece in the CSS toolkit‚Äù first started landing in browsers, but despite container queries being a highly requested and now well supported feature, Josh opines that we aren‚Äôt really using it all that much (however...). Here he goes into why take up may be low, reintroduces us to the feature, and suggests how we may want to approach using it.
articles.author: Josh W. Comeau

articles.title: Exploring the Browser Rendering Process
articles.description: A technical look at what actually occurs between typing a URL in your browser and the moment a page is displayed. It‚Äôs a solid explainer of the browser rendering process (told in an interactive way).
articles.author: Abhishek Saha

articles.title: Should Masonry Be Part of CSS Grid?
articles.description: As the conversation around just how best to add Masonry layout to CSS continues, Ahmad explores the leading options and shares his take. This post looks at both masonry as both a part of CSS Grid and as its own display type. As is typical with Ahmad‚Äôs work, there's lots of good code examples and visuals here to help explain things.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: The Details and Summary Elements Are Getting An Upgrade
articles.description: A quick look at proposed changes to make the <details> element more customizable and interoperable between browsers.
articles.author: Stephanie Stimac

articles.title: Eleven HTML Best Practices for Login and Sign-up Forms
articles.description: Andrey notes that ‚Äúeven popular sites fail to implement‚Äù the best practices highlighted in this recently updated article (such as autocomplete, focus states, validation, etc). There‚Äôs a quick checklist towards the end here.
articles.author: Andrey Sitnik

articles.title: Mastering Interaction to Next Paint (INP)
articles.description: A look at what this Core Web Vitals metric is measuring, how to diagnose it, and, most importantly, how to fix it so your site interactions nice and responsive.
articles.author: Todd Gardner

articles.title: What Do Survey Demographics Tell Us?
articles.description: Miriam looks over the latest State of CSS survey results, and shares her thoughts on the findings and whether we‚Äôre asking the right questions.
articles.author: Miriam Suzanne

articles.title: Clarifying the Relationship Between Popovers and Dialogs
articles.description: An attempt to clear up any potential confusion you may have here, along with summarizing the key mental model to takeaway.
articles.author: Zell Liew

articles.title: Scroll-Driven‚Ä¶ Sections
articles.description: Explores using scroll-driven animations to create an experimental sectional ‚Äòstorytelling‚Äô reading experience.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: What‚Äôs the Deal with WebKit Font Smoothing?
articles.description: On whether or not we should add this one line of CSS to our projects.
articles.author: David Bushell

articles.title: skellyCSS: A Lightweight CSS Framework to Quickly Implement Skeletons Into Your Projects
articles.description: For showing gray placeholder content often seen during page load. There‚Äôs also a web components library based on the framework.
articles.author: RIMdev

articles.title: Web Visual Editor: A VS Code Extension to Edit HTML Files¬†Visually
articles.description: Works similar to the browser devtools, providing a live preview of visual changes with element selection, copy/paste elements, zoom in/out, drag elements, and more. A key difference to the well known Live Preview is that changes in the preview then reflect back in the code.
articles.author: Hayato Takenaka

articles.title: Orbit: A Framework to Create Radial Interfaces with CSS
articles.description: Includes various CSS classes and Custom Elements for designing ‚Äòradial‚Äô or circular graphics and designs. The docs includes plenty of examples for this niche framework.
articles.author: Zumer Lab

articles.title: VS Code Theme Generator: An Online Tool to Generate and Customize VS Code Themes
articles.description: The UI lets you preview the theme as you work and you have the ability to have granular control over the tokens in the syntax highlighting.
articles.author: Rodrigo Luglio

articles.title: i-html: A Drop-In Web Component That Allows for Dynamically Importing HTML Inline
articles.description: Described as being ‚Äòsimilar to an iframe‚Äô, except that the HTML is ‚Äòadopted‚Äô into the page. The benefits and use cases are explained in detail here.
articles.author: keith cirkel
